column4: excuse my ignorance, but why does sudo apt-get install w32codecs return "E: Couldn't find package w32codecs" ?
can you pastebin me what it wants to remove please
http://rafb.net/paste/results/eavPVU21.html - it seems a little excessive don't you think? :p
all those packages depend on that lib please do not uninstall it. (is there a reason why you want to uninstall it?
ye, after i installed the ati fglrx driver, xv can not be used
xvinfo says there are no adapters present
i thought re-installing it might fix it
looks like you are missing something x-video needs to run
ye, but i don't know what, i have the ati driver setup correctly, glxinfo says direct rendering is enabled
yes i saw that thats why i think something is missing but im not sure either
i thought xv just uses the xorg video driver module to do rendering which is all setup correctly
although i do get a strange thing with mplayer when i try and use xv, it says it can't access /dev/3dfx. which makes me think xv is trying to use the wrong video card
could be that i would look for in the config files for xv you should beable to find them in home  ~/.xvideo
there is no config file for it
